snippet: The Little Free Library, an international movement with 2,200 book-trading outposts, now has one in Prospect Heights.
abstract: New York City gets its first official Little Free Library book-trading outpost, in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn; the national Little Free Library organization estimates that there are 2,200 such places, across almost every state and about 30 countries; nonprofit venture is an effort to encourage reading and improve literacy, but its advocates say the free libraries can also quickly become the hub of a community.
lead_paragraph: The Little Free Library, an international movement with 2,200 book-trading outposts, now has one in Prospect Heights.

headline.seo: Book-Trading Post Opens on a Brooklyn Sidewalk
headline.main: Barely Bigger Than a Breadbox, but Teeming With Literary Treasures in Brooklyn
headline.print_headline: Barely Bigger Than a Breadbox, but Teeming With Literary Treasures in Brooklyn
